jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

2C72A4E83ACF439AA74BC9A550DB7E81.description: CSIS5: Recite prayers and poems of substance that encourage all to strive for virtue and goodness.

CCCC62D48D854500B8A050BE24F1D01D.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. Capitalize on opportunities to
practice these skills within a liturgical context modeling Christ.

A0F1F095F8B041CDA997637D4CEBD1A1.description: Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, sound) and visual displays in presentations to clarify information.

0DB4217322C147BE94103772C6750B40.description:
Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes; use
appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

E1A24F160C3445AD9DB6A0323665199A.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

832F402489E74C0C87697E70BB49DB3E.description:
Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats including but not limited to Catholic texts and sources (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally)
and explain how it contributes to a topic, text, or issue under study.

99E6D947FE6244FCB88F9332FAA93D58.description: Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection and paraphrasing.

BDE708F0B9FC404BBB6B89A9633DC360.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under
discussion.

71277893967E4645800A0DAB4D763148.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

D6952F19CA8C4DC68829665D0055B87B.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic,
text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

B301BB2ABEF54DAD8E49F9EE29A14E4A.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led), building on others’ ideas and expressing their own
clearly.

D0D8791CF8654D5F966B441C678E0250.description: Share the beauty and cadence of poetry for its impact on human sensibilities and formation of the soul. CSDS9

C3BCD8CE0CC64CAE900C45F0E303ECF8.description: Delight and wonder through reading aloud or listening to creative, sound, and healthy stories, and poems and plays. CSDS7

204E5A6E16AB486E940617FED859C222.description: Share beautifully told and well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

9347BA23D5C24B1DB7392F8A25F11F13.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

C14D905620ED42F79CCAF05EE2AA9ED5.description: Interact with people, recognizing diversity, using discussion techniques and language that reflects Catholic teaching and values.

EEFBF110ACAD4256AF6781752463C8AB.description: Catholic Standards for Speaking and Listening

380AD7E175D942DCB60DF46100F61050.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases (including faith literacy); gather vocabulary
knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

935A31766A1945FBB3B9FF48B45C89D2.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, non-wasteful,
thrifty).

A9569E1F61C745FBB7A5AFD47ED551BA.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words.

373B8B197AC6479B82BFA1585179FC2F.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.

51DDC4E7604E4A1786160054FDE76E5D.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

A3648806A2D14563A4A9B7855CDDAC5E.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

FF032B50F6854883B93D0CD4472077ED.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or
clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

C61B22190D6B49DCA0C1266FDA8C84E8.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

8542205A6A724E66AE18A5CF0C898546.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or
phrase.

CC8B1704870C4241958A0BB266D2BDEC.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on Grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a
range of strategies.

7F0D7DE249DF4CBF8A8F63729A1BB17A.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.

2DB06A99F3934F26888F303D25B81990.description: Vary sentence patterns and structures (e.g., simple, compound, complex, compound-complex) for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

9A5F5C3667DD4AB8953E1905F8BED011.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

A918937C49744D00A1A592EA35FF087B.description: Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

FA1E0CACAFEC41C4B0136C3A6612DCA0.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing

3A999A666CDE427C86957B6390A656E4.description: Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.

1DFD338AB58A419EA9ED91967235BDCF.description:
Recognize variations from standard English in their own and others’ writing and speaking, and identify and use strategies to improve expression in
conventional language.

D07345AFE7B74F098FD560AD3AC0AF5A.description: Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).

BABC6921BCDB41A586AFF75B1AF4A032.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.

36BA6E0F936E48B6961CD8CCABC80E60.description: Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

6BC8644F4723413B9F3C1D5E59A85BCB.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

361C611D63C54C3795F295AF49435515.description: Use language to order our thoughts and to accurately express knowledge and feelings. CSWS2

6CA147D5E9664DC699C0205BC9BD16DF.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

EFBE56B57C33430AA69926FE6D5F2F2B.description: Exhibit an understanding that words are important to the Word.

9BA4767D1AB540B28BB2BBF085D9B790.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range
of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

1C0BA8678A8A441BBB8CA4EBD47791FE.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts including but not limited to Catholic texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

FE62F59088C94783BCAA094D0B70C972.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions
of others while exercising the virtue of honesty and providing basic bibliographic information for sources, images, and ideas thus eliminating plagiarism.

9B9B8F5BA9404C009DFFFBF26BABFAD3.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

C8D85825BAAE4564A2DA6DD715A5D1BC.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

4D36A4D98F694A2C8B371FD98DDDACAA.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command
of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

8912E5A300D348F59D17DE15E6E317E2.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing including multi-media works reflecting a Catholic theme as
needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

0F0630426FA44988A275DAC3BB4FC566.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. Examples may
include prayers, Catholic themes/topics, and reflective essays.

39961765534B423F93AFB8CA977BB4D0.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

C497E95855B044109B7D19B6042D7403.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.

DB7FD8BDAA094CD780D259A3B48A140C.description: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

C19121CFB2084D46869FC27CC0904920.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

F32FBA398DFB4A37903C8744C0F7E6E7.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally
and logically.

B028095FB64E4CEAAD85F244B30C140B.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event
sequences.

1D72F0E565444C47B602AD64692FD4FF.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

8EFF8B29802A4598B08E4ADE9EAF09A8.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

545F4B6BF6CC43C1B5126CE314018CBC.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

A5B385F121644B08824C13E20307C077.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

CC061B56623A497C8118B1813239757E.description:
Develop the topic (including but not limited to a Catholic topic) with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and
examples.

534670F59B314731BD12A6D42D637BFE.description:
Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect;
include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

29E97082CF234C3B9E7A9F996B0181EB.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of
relevant content.

FDB6D37F5036480FBB0747383C3E126B.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the argument presented.

F5D901EDD2DE4564B9C222F2CB63DA09.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

CB3655CF54F74191B5F3413836702B3A.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons.

78B79C9C1BE8432FAA43441429FF2CE8.description:
Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources (including but not limited to Catholic texts) and demonstrating an
understanding of the topic or text.

2EBE2C290A32403DAB5C40A95006881D.description: Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence clearly.

3E2FDAE6DD134C81B47C522412F1112F.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence while maintaining Catholic values and identity.

B9295FDDC59B464B96330E988F89CE20.description: CSDS8: Write stories about characters possessing virtue and begin to exhibit these virtuous behaviors and attitudes.

98218F57F17344FDB4D42349A9FF097A.description: CSIS14: Write to explore reasoning and intent.

F7EC091C0F5B407AB32980224405DAC4.description: CSIS8: Write to develop personal judgment based on truth, goodness and virtue.

4533EB585B98408485A8E88A00B5E306.description: CSIS2: Write how spiritual knowledge and truth are represented and communicated through fairy tales, fables, myths, parables, and stories.

1D08E557ECFC40D5BF02805222E2B8B8.description: Write in ways to order our thoughts, align them with truth, and accurately express knowledge and feelings. CSWS2

13768150AB3C458685EBC72A0E7B00E4.description: Share well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

C71243831F0F4F1A94557A1B5D970F3F.description: Create written works that glorify the Creator, reflect the heart of the Redeemer and are inspired by the Spirit.
